action.action-desc: Mr. Gomez (for himself, Mr. Aguilar, Ms. Titus, and Ms. Barragán) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

form.official-title: To establish a program so that business concerns owned and controlled by socially and economically disadvantaged individuals may achieve proficiency to compete, on an equal basis, for contracts and subcontracts in Department of Transportation projects, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Accelerating Small Business Growth Act.

subsection.text: The Secretary of Transportation shall establish a competitive grant program to provide financial assistance to eligible entities to establish and carry out innovative programs so that business concerns owned and controlled by socially and economically disadvantaged individuals may achieve proficiency to compete, on an equal basis, for contracts and subcontracts in projects carried out with financial assistance from the Secretary.
An entity eligible to receive financial assistance under this section is—

paragraph.text: a State or territory of the United States;
a political subdivision of a State or local government;
a special purpose district or public authority with a transit or aviation function;
a group of entities described in paragraphs (1) through (6).

subsection.text: To be eligible to participate in the program under this section, an eligible entity shall submit to the Secretary an application at such time, in such manner, and containing such information as the Secretary may require.
In carrying out activities with a grant under this section, an eligible entity may partner with—

paragraph.text: 1 or more institutions of higher education.
Not later than 2 years after an eligible entity is awarded a grant under this section, the eligible entity shall submit to the Secretary a report that includes—

subparagraph.text: a description of the activities carried out with the grant; and
an evaluation of the effectiveness of those activities in meeting the objectives described in subsection (b).

paragraph.text: Each report submitted under paragraph (1) shall be made available on a public internet website managed by the Secretary.

subsection.text: Not later than 3 years after the date of enactment of this Act, the Secretary shall submit to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure of the House of Representatives and the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation of the Senate a report that evaluates the program under this section.

subsection.header: Definition of socially and economically disadvantaged individuals
subsection.text: The term socially and economically disadvantaged individuals has the meaning given the term in section 11101(e)(2) of the Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act (23 U.S.C. 101 note; Public Law 117–58).
There is authorized to be appropriated to carry out this section $5,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2024 through 2026.
